name: 蘇益生
objective: This course gives the essential advanced topics in digital signal processing (DSP) that are necessary for successful graduate-level research. The course includes a review of the linear constant-coefficient systems covered in an undergraduate DSP course, and then examines the discrete-time Fourier transform (DTFT),  two-sided z-transform, sampling and quantization analysis of continuous-time signals, multi-rate signal processing, digital filter designs, discrete Fourier series (DFS) and discrete Fourier transform (DFT), fast Fourier transform (FFT), and other topics relevant to the research areas of the students.
schedule:
Week 1, 2 & 3: Discrete-Time Signals, Systems, and Fourier Transform (DTFT)
Week 4 & 5: The Bilateral z-Transform
Week 6, 7 & 8: Digital Processing of Continuous-Time Signals
Week 9: Midterm Exam
Week 10, 11 & 12: Filter Design Techniques
Week 13, 14 & 15: The Discrete Fourier Series (DFS) and the Discrete Fourier Transform (DFT)
Week 16 & 17: The Fast Fourier Transform (FFT)
Week 18: Final Exam

The course schedule is subject to change on the basis of class progress.
scorePolicy:
Midterm Exam: 25% 
Final Exam: 25%
Regular Grade (Attendance+Quizzes): 50%

The grading policy is subject to change.
materials:
Textbook: 
A. V. Oppenheim and R. W. Schafer, "Discrete-Time Signal Processing," 3rd Ed., Pearson, 2010.

Reference:
J. G. Proakis and D. G. Manolakis, "Digital Signal Processing: Principles, Algorithms, and Applications," 4th Ed., Prentice Hall, 2007.
